required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Causative Insects in Severe Insect Sting Allergy
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating the Causative Insects in the Cases With Severe Insect Sting Allergy

brief_summary.textblock: Study the causative insect by skin prick test and sIgE to wasp, bee and fire ants are important but false positive by crossreactivity can occur. sIgE to recombinant venom allergen is proposed to help in finding the causative insect.

detailed_description.textblock:
Insect sting allergy from insects in Hymenoptera is not uncommon. The reaction maybe very severe and life threatening. To find the cause of insect sting allergy is important in prevention and specific treatment such as immunotherapy. The skin prick test and sIgE of these insects may have cross reactions so it is difficult to be interpreted.
The usage of sIgE recombinant venom allergen can benefit in separate cross reaction and dual allergy reaction.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean wheal diameters of skin prick test of local and imported insect allergens
primary_outcome.description: Compare Mean wheal diameters of skin prick test of local and imported insect allergens at different concentrations

secondary_outcome.measure: specific IgE level to stinging insect allergen and recombinant venom allergens
secondary_outcome.description: compare skin prick test result and levels of specific IgE level to stinging insect allergen and recombinant venom allergens

arm_group.description: Skin prick tests to local and imported insect sting allergen with different concentration are performed. sIgE Measurement (to insect and the recombinant venom)

intervention.description: Skin prick tests to local and imported insect sting allergen with different concentration are performed.
sIgE levels to stinging insect allergen and their recombinant venom allergen are measured

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Cases with severe insect sting allergy reactions
Exclusion Criteria:
- Without other severe systemic diseases
- Not pregnant or lactation
